reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many reviews on the 'net, we decided to try the Beresford Hotel. Since we were just meeting a friend and needed a place to sleep, I wasn't looking for anything fancy. Generally, the hotel was exactly what I expected. It is an older hotel, but the staff was friendly and it is in a great location. Upon arrival, we were asked to double park in front of the hotel while the valet parking attendant arrived (15-20 minutes). It was traffic hour and we did not feel comfortable doing this, so that caused some tension for the employee who was in charge of this....but he found a place for us in front of a nearby garage temporarily. Other than that, all employee's were very friendly. The hotel looks nice even though the decor has not been refurbished for some time. Going up to our room, there was an "old" smell. I am very sensitive to smells, so this was a little bothersome for me. My husband said he liked it and it reminded him of his grandparents home. The decor of the hotel is outdated: older - but good quality and clean carpet, wall paper, etc. Our room was clean. We asked for two twin beds because this hotel does not have King or queen beds, and the two of us on a double just didn't sound good. The beds were comfortable, more so for me I think, as I am small. The bathroom was basic, but fine. There was shampoo, conditioner and soap available. I asked for a QUIET room, as I don't like to be interupted when I sleep, so they put us on the 6th floor facing a non-vehicle alley which was, indeed, quiet. Breakfast consisted of Cold cereal (3 choices), whole fruits (oranges, apples and bananas), tea, coffee, juice and cocoa, and pastries (croissants and swirl fruit-in-the-center type). The surrounding area of the hotel is fine - I felt perfectly safe walking at night.
reviews.title: As Expected

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is fine for an overnight stay. If you are expecting plush new accommodations where you will enjoy hanging out in your room, this is not the place for you. But if you are ok with the basics, this hotel will do. San Francisco usually has somewhat higher prices for hotels, so for the money this place is acceptable. In the future if I had the time, I would keep looking for a better deal, but if this is where I ended up I would be ok with that too.
reviews.title: clean but minimal
Great Room, Great Price
reviews.text: We just returned from the Hotel Beresford which is well located near Union Square. The hotel was worn, but fairly clean. The room was tiny. The queen sized bed had shabby linens and a creaky headboard. The small bathroom had a shower, with no bathtub, shower cap or even a hair dryer. The staff was pleasant, however we had to wait a long time for our car, and parking was $20 extra. There is no air conditioning so we had the windows wide open, which was great except for the construction crew that started working very loudly, just below our room at 7:30 am. We've stayed in San Francisco a lot - you can do better than this.

reviews.title: a horrible experience
reviews.text: My wife and I went out to San Francisco on our honeymoon. We stayed at the Hotel Beresford for three nights. Our corner double room was ideal for us. While the room was smallish, it was all that we needed. The bed was a very comfortable Queen. Mainly what we liked was the price. With our AAA discount the price of the room was less than $90! For a hotel just off Union Square in San Francisco that was a steal. The room came with a complimentary continental breakfast and the service in the hotel was first-rate: the concierge was helpful and effecient, check-in and check-out were both handled with no fuss and the cleaning service never missed a step.

The cons for this hotel are the size of the rooms and the bathrooms in the rooms. We had a small shower with no tub and a very loud toilet, so loud that you couldn't talk while it was filling the tank. This was such a minor problem that it doesn't really affect the review. If you want a good, inexpensive hotel room near Union Square in San Francisco, try the Hotel Beresford.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant

reviews.text: Yes, the bathroom was tiny. But it had a great shower (and who needs bathtubs when they're only 5" deep anyway?!), and we never had any issues with low water pressure or availability of hot water.

reviews.title: Best Kept Secret Of San Francisco
reviews.text: On My First trip to S.F. I booked a room for seven days at the St. Regis, I was totally disappointed especially at nearly $400.00 a night, the room was small and outdated and there was an odor, I met a local who told me about the Hotel Beresford, so I went there and checked it out and liked what I saw. the room looked about the same as that of the St. Regis, in size and furnishings, and at a special rate that the front desk gave me of $59.00 a night, I checked out of the St. Francis who then offered to move me to a suite . But as far as I was concerned at 400.00 dollars a night, I should have been there in the first place. Off to the Beresford I went and each year when I travel to S.F. I stay there, and I am also greeted with upon entering my room and fruit and wine basket with a card that reads WELCOME BACK!
Two blocks down from the Union sq, also a couple of blocks away from China town.

reviews.title: Great little hotel near Union Square
Exactly what you need in San Francisco
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's exactly where you want to be when you are in San Francisco! You are IN Union Square a few meters from all the stores and shopping you could ever want. As well, you are 2 blocks from the historic tram which will take you directly to Fisherman's Wharf. It's walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, the museums and even Fisherman's Wharf if you so choose.

reviews.title: Clean and neat, but tiny rroms
reviews.text: The hotel itself was much better than I expected given the very affordable price. The room was big enough and very clean, the bathroom was very adequate and the staff were helpful. There was a very reasonably priced mini bar in the room, which made it actually worth it. There is a breakfast, but it is very mediocre.

The only small glitch is that the hotel restaurant closes its kitchen at 9:30. So if after a full day of traipsing around the wonderful city that is San Francisco you just want to grab a quick soup or salad before bed, the hotel restaurant will not be able to provide that for you.
reviews.title: Good stop, but only for a day...

reviews.text: Otherwise would recommend this restaurant to my friends and family for sure!
reviews.title: Great value for the location

reviews.text: My wife and I recently attended a play in SF ("Jersey Boys", terrific) and wanted a reasonably priced hotel in the theatre district; the Beresford Hotel filled the bill. Our room on the 5th floor was clean and quiet but pretty small; the queen bed practically filled the room and the bathroom was about the smallest we've seen. Not that it was uncomfortable, just tiny! The staff was polite and helpful, the included breakfast was about what you'd expect: cereals, sweet rolls, some fruit, coffee and teas. Parking is avaliable on the same block at the Olympic Club ($30). We booked directly with the hotel for $98.75 plus tax. For our purposes, it was just fine; after all, when you're in San Francisco, how much time do you spend in your hotel room?
reviews.title: more than adequate
